summary.para: Initializes an instance of a shader module that is used for resource rebinding.

param.name: pNamespace
param.para: The name of a shader module to initialize. This can be NULL if you don't want to specify a name for the module.

param.name: ppModuleInstance
param.para: The address of a pointer to an interface to initialize.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful; otherwise, returns one of the Direct3D 11 Return Codes.

summary.para: A module interface creates an instance of a module that is used for resource rebinding. Note This interface is part of the HLSL shader linking technology that you can use on all Direct3D 11 platforms to create precompiled HLSL functions, package them into libraries, and link them into full shaders at run time.

remarks.para: To get a module interface, call .
Note ID3D11Module requires the D3dcompiler_47.dll or a later version of the DLL.
